description: From Middle English rarefien, from Old French rarefier (French raréfier), from Latin rarefacere (“make rare”). Surface etymology is rare +‎ -fy.

verbs.description: rarefy (third-person singular simple present rarefies, present participle rarefying, simple past and past participle rarefied)

entries.meaning: To make rare, thin, porous, or less dense
To expand or enlarge without adding any new portion of matter to.
